private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are vowels: A E I
I can only manipulate one top block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Reconfigure the blocks into the target tower ordering: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N
I can only manipulate one top block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Reconfigure the blocks into the target tower ordering: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver that achieves the target tower ordering: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on the table.

public_information: There are labeled blocks H L N B K G J A C F M I D E in the environment.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a single table surface. A block can only be moved if it is the top block of its stack.
Agents can manipulate at most one block at a time and can only interact with top blocks.
One agent is restricted to vowel-labelled blocks and the other is restricted to consonant-labelled blocks.
Initial configuration: H is on the table.
N is on top of L.
B is on top of N.
G is on top of K.
J is on top of B.
A is on top of J.
C is on top of G.
F is on top of A.
M is on top of H.
I is on top of F.
D is on top of C.
E is on top of D.

The goal configuration is a single long tower with the following stacking from top to bottom: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N on the table.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate vowel-labelled blocks. Provide a clear analysis describing which vowel blocks you can move given only top-of-stack constraints, identify any local moves you can perform to progress toward the global goal, and produce a compact partial PDDL fragment or abstract action specification summarizing your capabilities and assumptions. Do not emit the final integrated PDDL domain and problem. Keep your output focused on your percepts, allowed actions, and suggested local ordering contributions.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You observe the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your task is to analyze the parts of the problem you can affect and to produce a concise partial representation of actions, predicates, and initial facts that concern vowel blocks only. If some information is missing, state assumptions explicitly rather than inventing unrelated facts.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate consonant-labelled blocks. Provide a clear analysis describing which consonant blocks you can move given only top-of-stack constraints, identify local moves you can perform to progress toward the global goal, and produce a compact partial PDDL fragment or abstract action specification summarizing your capabilities and assumptions. Do not emit the final integrated PDDL domain and problem. Keep your output focused on your percepts, allowed actions, and suggested local ordering contributions.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You observe the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your task is to analyze the parts of the problem you can affect and to produce a concise partial representation of actions, predicates, and initial facts that concern consonant blocks only. If some information is missing, state assumptions explicitly rather than inventing unrelated facts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and integration. Your responsibility is to take the partial analyses from the agents, resolve naming differences and assumptions, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that is compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing actions coming from different agents. Ensure the domain encodes top-of-stack constraints, single-block manipulation, and agent-specific type or predicate restrictions so the solver can validate which agent can perform which actions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The goal to achieve is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the public information about the environment: {environment->public_information}. Here is the vowel agent analysis and its partial output: {pddl_vowel_fragment}. Here is the consonant agent analysis and its partial output: {pddl_consonant_fragment}. Integrate these fragments, resolve any conflicts or different names, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions that would be executed by the vowel agent distinct from those executed by the consonant agent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
